title: How do you ensure accurate application monitoring for hybrid cloud applications?

content:
Hybrid cloud application monitoring refers to tracking the performance, availability, and health status of applications in a hybrid cloud environment. It is crucial because when enterprises rely on multiple cloud platforms, they need to ensure seamless operation of cross-cloud applications to support business continuity, which is applicable to high-availability scenarios such as finance and e-commerce.

The core includes centralized monitoring tools, unified log and metric collection, real-time analysis, and automatic alerts. Features involve cross-environment consistency, data aggregation, and AI-driven anomaly detection. When applied, it improves operational efficiency, reduces fault response time, and optimizes cloud resource utilization.

Implementation steps: Deploy a unified monitoring system such as Prometheus or Grafana; standardize collection protocols like OpenTelemetry; set threshold alarms and dashboards; iteratively optimize strategies. Business values include reducing downtime, enhancing user experience, supporting scalable operations, and ensuring compliance.
